oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Bob McDill Interviewed by Bob Allen in 1982 Side Two
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Bob Allen interviewing Bob McDill. The recording takes place on 04-14-82.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Bob McDill
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side Two - (0:10) -- Bob McDill discusses discovering Ralph Waldo Emerson. (1:45) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill about his writing influences. (4:10) -- Bob McDill shares his opinion on liberal economics. (6:18) -- Bob McDill discusses socialism in relation to economics. (12:03) -- Bob McDill mentions working with Bobby Bare. (12:54) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill about his collection of books. (14:15) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill about his personal reading habits. (16:24) -- Discussion about Bob McDill's cigars. (18:23) -- Bob McDill discusses the first people he met in Nashville, Bill Rice & Jerry Foster. (19:39) -- Bob Allen asks whether Bob McDill still writes songs eight hours a day. Bob McDill responds that he still works this way. (20:40) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill whether he still enjoys songwriting professionally. (21:59) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill about whether he brings songs home to finish. (23:03) -- Bob McDill discusses writer's block. (24:42) -- Bob Allen discusses the solitude required when writing music. (25:17) -- Bob Allen asks Bob McDill about his work with Don Williams. (26:45) -- Bob Allen asks about whether Bob McDill has experienced writer's despair or experienced great frustration writing.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: McDill, Bob;
